page.title: 01Introduction to Sharnbrook
page.content: The village of{Sharnbrook}lies on low, undulating hills between the valleys of the{River Ouse}and the{Sharn Brook. Most of the housing development has taken place on the north facing slope of the smaller valley of the Sharn, well above the flood level. The Sharn rises near Hobbs Green, flows N.West for about 2km.,then flows S.East. To the west of the village is Colworth House, home of{Unilever Research {Establishment,}the area's biggest employer. To the south, between the village and the R.Ouse, is the{Felmersham Nature {Reserve}_ a complex of worked out gravel pits looked after by the Hunts. and Beds. Naturalists' Trust. {Odell}village, where a{leather}works has been established, is 3km. west of Sharnbrook.{
